newsitem.title: USA: USDA to begin weekly cheddar cheese price May 9.
newsitem.headline: USDA to begin weekly cheddar cheese price May 9.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department said on May 9 it will begin publishing a weekly U.S. cheddar cheese price report, it was announced Friday.
The report will list weighted average prices and volume of sales by manufacturers for 40-lb blocks, 640-lb blocks and 500-lb barrels of cheddar cheese.
USDA said it would provide regional data where possible.
The May 9 report will contain data for weeks ending March 7-May 2. Subsequent reports will include data for the most recent five weeks.
Reports will be based on a survey of U.S. cheddar cheese manufacturers that sell cheese on a bulk, wholesale basis.
USDA began the survey in March as part of an effort to see if a reliable price could be calculated. Dissatisfaction had been expressed with an exchange that set cheese prices.
The report will be issued at 0830 EDT/1230 GMT.
